intro: Sisymbrium ameghinoi, commonly known as the Argentine babylon wheat, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately lobed, with a hairy texture. Sisymbrium ameghinoi is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
